comment._content: Amos Pinchot: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amos_Pinchot Lady Johnstone made the news 1908 for her shocking behavor: smoking on a cruise liner! query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B01E5DB1F3EE233A...

comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: Amos with his sister, a wife of a foreign dipolmat - children of lumber baron James W. Pinchot, a founder of the Conservation Movement - Amos, part of the "Bull Moose" in 1912, and aquaintance of President Theodore TEDDY Roosevelt - later labeled as a pacifist, frequent speaker, writer, and author - spoke against large military buildup, founded isolationist group that dissolved after US entered WWII - was also against the growing role of big business in national politcs - moralist - rumored to have unsuccessfully attempted suicide out of depression over WWII Lady Alan - AKA Antoinette Pinchot - society leader, reputedly entertained in London at the Ritz, Edwardian fashionable - see also: www.yourbrotherkings.com/?p=100
